abstract: A week after AT&T‘s chief executive said he would step down, the head of the telecommunication company’s mergers and acquisitions team announced he also will retire. James Kahan, the senior executive vice president for corporate development who helped spearhead $200 billion in deals, including the acquisition of BellSouth, will step down on June 30, the company announced Saturday.
lead_paragraph: A week after AT&T‘s chief executive said he would step down, the head of the telecommunication company’s mergers and acquisitions team announced he also will retire. James Kahan, the senior executive vice president for corporate development who helped spearhead $200 billion in deals, including the acquisition of BellSouth, will step down on June 30, the company announced Saturday.

headline.main: AT&T Mergers Chief to Step Down
